commit_message:
Router appended twice to routers list when created with create_router_by_client

create_router_by_client creates a router by calling either create_router
or create_admin_router
In all these cases, the router is appened twice to the routers list,
i.e. the router is duplicated in that list

Change-Id: I1844abc9d5f14611141b19e9003077e2396fba2a

commit_message:
Reload SG rules when security group is requested

In case when security group is requested by e.g. L2 agent via RPC,
there was a problem that rules which belongs to the SG wasn't reloaded
and wasn't given in requested OVO version.
That wasn't a problem so far as we always had SecurityGroupRule OVO in
version 1.0 but in case when version of this OVO will be bumped, it will
not work properly with agents from the previous version anymore.

This patch fixes that issue by adding reload of SG rules when
SecurityGroup.obj_load_attr() is called.

Change-Id: I008bf31369029c418a0e080e02283e8103428d2b
Closes-Bug: #1903696

commit_message:
Fix ansible-lint star expansion

Tox doesn't use bash, so to be able to expand the list of files
using the * character, we need to run ansible-lint under bash.

Change-Id: I413d17288d81882998ee58a156ba7abe53a592a0

[{'created': '2020-12-14 01:06:00.000000000', 'message': 'Consistently use utils functions for policy auth

The check_policy function exists in api utils, along with other more
complex policy utility functions. This change replaces direct calls to
authorize with calls to check_policy.

commit_message:
Consistently use utils functions for policy auth

The check_policy function exists in api utils, along with other more
complex policy utility functions. This change replaces direct calls to
authorize with calls to check_policy.

Having authorize calls consolidated in api utils may help with the
upcoming secure-rbac work.

Change-Id: If4779b08b9f360f4c2f4675c605aa519f6ea4778

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

messages:
[{'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2020-12-18 11:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.

The following files contain Git conflicts:
* ansible/roles/common/tasks/config.yml'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-12-18 11:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This patch is not backwards compatible, which is why we did not backport it originally.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2020-12-18 14:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> This patch is not backwards compatible, which is why we did not backport it originally.

I know, but if I resolve conflicts, can be backported after changes ?'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2020-12-18 14:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

conflicts'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-18 11:15:56.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: Run common role in a separate play

The common role was previously added as a dependency to all other roles.
It would set a fact after running on a host to avoid running twice. This
had the nice effect that deploying any service would automatically pull
in the common services for that host. When using tags, any services with
matching tags would also run the common role. This could be both
surprising and sometimes useful.

When using Ansible at large scale, there is a penalty associated with
executing a task against a large number of hosts, even if it is skipped.
The common role introduces some overhead, just in determining that it
has already run.

This change extracts the common role into a separate play, and removes
the dependency on it from all other roles. New groups have been added
for cron, fluentd, and kolla-toolbox, similar to other services. This
changes the behaviour in the following ways:

* The common role is now run for all hosts at the beginning, rather than
  prior to their first enabled service
* Hosts must be in the necessary group for each of the common services
  in order to have that service deployed. This is mostly to avoid
  deploying on localhost or the deployment host
* If tags are specified for another service e.g. nova, the common role
  will *not* automatically run for matching hosts. The common tag must
  be specified explicitly

The last of these is probably the largest behaviour change. While it
would be possible to determine which hosts should automatically run the
common role, it would be quite complex, and would introduce some
overhead that would probably negate the benefit of splitting out the
common role.

Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements

Change-Id: I6a4676bf6efeebc61383ec7a406db07c7a868b2a
(cherry picked from commit 56ae2db7ac694d7c651623aa7d2e23b3386bd2b2)
'}]
commit_message:
Performance: Run common role in a separate play

The common role was previously added as a dependency to all other roles.
It would set a fact after running on a host to avoid running twice. This
had the nice effect that deploying any service would automatically pull
in the common services for that host. When using tags, any services with
matching tags would also run the common role. This could be both
surprising and sometimes useful.

When using Ansible at large scale, there is a penalty associated with
executing a task against a large number of hosts, even if it is skipped.
The common role introduces some overhead, just in determining that it
has already run.

This change extracts the common role into a separate play, and removes
the dependency on it from all other roles. New groups have been added
for cron, fluentd, and kolla-toolbox, similar to other services. This
changes the behaviour in the following ways:

* The common role is now run for all hosts at the beginning, rather than
  prior to their first enabled service
* Hosts must be in the necessary group for each of the common services
  in order to have that service deployed. This is mostly to avoid
  deploying on localhost or the deployment host
* If tags are specified for another service e.g. nova, the common role
  will *not* automatically run for matching hosts. The common tag must
  be specified explicitly

The last of these is probably the largest behaviour change. While it
would be possible to determine which hosts should automatically run the
common role, it would be quite complex, and would introduce some
overhead that would probably negate the benefit of splitting out the
common role.

Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements

Change-Id: I6a4676bf6efeebc61383ec7a406db07c7a868b2a
(cherry picked from commit 56ae2db7ac694d7c651623aa7d2e23b3386bd2b2)

commit_message:
Stop using platform-python

Since python2 is not supported long time - there's
no need to use /usr/libexec/platform-python.
Also for supporting Debian/Ubuntu - we need to
change that to /usr/bin/python3.

Change-Id: I0d477325e0edd13d1aba211c13dc2e8b7a9b4c98

commit_message:
Remove Chrome browser from karma.conf.js

This patch removes Chrome browser from
karma.conf.js as nodejs job fails with Chrome
browser because it is not able to access some URL.
So let's remove Chrome browser now then we can add
it again once the issue is resolved.

Also as discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Co-Authored-By: Riccardo Pittau <elfosardo@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic7094ab6ed01af2bcbe0beb13f300499215fd903

commit_message:
port-backend API defination

This patch adds a new API "port_backend". This API aims
at describing a profile of hardware device which can be
 associate with a neutron port.

Implements: blueprint sriov-smartnic-support

Change-Id: I8171996e1b4d079d398b7d05bc2dc2f35e8ab073

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-04 02:08:41.000000000', 'message': 'Only add gateway IP if defined during network extract

If the gateway IP was not a subnet (IPv4 or IPv6), the network extract
command was generating a network_data.yaml file that had an entry for
gateway_ip set to null. Example:

- dns_domain: storagemgmt.tripleodomain.
  mtu: 1400
  name: StorageMgmt
  name_lower: storage_mgmt
  subnets:
    storage_mgmt_subnet:
      allocation_pools:
      - end: 172.16.3.250
        start: 172.16.3.4
      gateway_ip: null
      ip_subnet: 172.16.3.0/24
      physical_network: storage_mgmt
      routes: []
      vlan: 40
  vip: true

During "openstack overcloud network provision", the yaml was then
failing validation since null is not a valid string value for gateway_ip
as defined in the schema.

This patch updates the tripleo_overcloud_network_extract module to only
add the gateway_ip[v6] key to the subnet info if it's actually defined
on the subnet object.

Change-Id: I9701064c33c2e319617d90da99db00d10ad68a0f
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Only add gateway IP if defined during network extract

If the gateway IP was not a subnet (IPv4 or IPv6), the network extract
command was generating a network_data.yaml file that had an entry for
gateway_ip set to null. Example:

- dns_domain: storagemgmt.tripleodomain.
  mtu: 1400
  name: StorageMgmt
  name_lower: storage_mgmt
  subnets:
    storage_mgmt_subnet:
      allocation_pools:
      - end: 172.16.3.250
        start: 172.16.3.4
      gateway_ip: null
      ip_subnet: 172.16.3.0/24
      physical_network: storage_mgmt
      routes: []
      vlan: 40
  vip: true

During "openstack overcloud network provision", the yaml was then
failing validation since null is not a valid string value for gateway_ip
as defined in the schema.

This patch updates the tripleo_overcloud_network_extract module to only
add the gateway_ip[v6] key to the subnet info if it's actually defined
on the subnet object.

Change-Id: I9701064c33c2e319617d90da99db00d10ad68a0f
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Also Cap version of ipa-builder to 2.2.0

Versions higher than 2.2.0 of ironic-python-agent-builder use
tinycore 11.x to build tinyipa, and that uses a kernel too recent
to be built on bionic.

Change-Id: Ide0f6c38a59ae6486fa33cfb19b383d022e57d5a
(cherry picked from commit 78b356cd44907287af60412113e1e15fe4ccaf0a)
(cherry picked from commit 95e1cd54cbe3a76dbe581a4283fe989463429d75)

commit_message:
Add daxio for nvdimm scenario

nova-compute uses daxio to cleanup vpmem backend device on instance
delete. If the daxio binary is missing in the nova-compute container
instance delete fails. daxio is provided in centos via daxio, in
ubuntu via the pmdk-tools package.

Change-Id: Ifb5948653565e2ae902783762e20e33527020efe
Closes-Bug: 1907124

commit_message:
CI: switch the multinode job to tempest-multinode-full-base

The non-base job is designed for the integrated gate and may have
unnecessary side effects. It has recently overriding the OVS agent
bridge settings, breaking our job.

Make the job voting again.

Also Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Plus Cap version of ipa-builder to 2.2.0

Versions higher than 2.2.0 of ironic-python-agent-builder use
tinycore 11.x to build tinyipa, and that uses a kernel too recent
to be built on bionic.

Change-Id: Ied8cafd32c3e634d498467ebe878a411f0b24e6d
(cherry picked from commit 97ceb38a725cac797f9acf2c643d76c36e7293e0)
(cherry picked from commit 840488e5951a360bb0f61ce36d33b5253ed19655)

commit_message:
Remove md5_factory function

...because otherwise I'll find myself wanting to just use it
*everywhere*, which seems to defeat the purpose.

Change-Id: I88c7a9fb78890302bb71aeaf63ad587e59767726

(1 comment)

Unit tests still have some failures, but at least the func tests should be happy.

What's the best way to functionally test this? Compile OpenSSL myself? Do we expect unit tests to still pass with FIPS mode on, or no?"}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-09-22 17:57:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Tim, 

Thanks for looking into the functional test failures.  I'll look into the unit tests later today as well.

I don't know at this point whether or not the tests will pass under FIPS.  This initial patch was simply to find and fix the places we know will fail under FIPS because of md5, which were identified by bandit.

There will be other issues with for example, key generation algorithms, key sizes etc., as well as issues like the one you pointed out which had not been detected by bandit.

Only testing with a FIPS enabled system will find all these issues - which is my next step - and one I'm be working on this week.  Issues uncovered there would be identified and resolved in follow-on patches.

To do this testing yourself (and that would be awesome!), you need a python and openssl that support the new keyword attribute.  https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 can point you to the relevant python patches - or you can use python on rhel8/centos8 - which already supports the keyword attribute.

This you need to set the system in FIPS mode, or run with an environment variable to set openssl in FIPS enforcing mode.

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/8/html/security_hardening/using-the-system-wide-cryptographic-policies_security-hardening#switching-the-system-to-fips-mode_using-the-system-wide-cryptographic-policies shows how to do this in rhel/centos 8.

I believe the env variable to set is OPENSSL_FIPS=1 otherwise."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-09-22 18:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-22 20:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-22 20:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

I *think* unit tests will be squared away now.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-09-23 19:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-23 19:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I did run the functional and unit tests on a FIPS enabled system and was able -- with the changes added in here -- to get all but two unit tests to pass.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-29 20:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

That's fantastic! I was half expecting the answer to wind up being, "we expect functional tests to pass, but unit tests are right out and not worth the trouble to even *try* to fix." ;-)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-29 22:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Needs to be released and updated in global requirements. Then this needs local updates to lower-constraints.txt and requirements.txt to ensure the version of the library used contains this functionality.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-06 23:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

So (I think) I've got a FIPS-enabled VM now:

 [vagrant@centos8 ~]$ sudo fips-mode-setup --check
 FIPS mode is enabled.

(And I *did* restart the VM after enabling; there was a bit of difficulty getting back into it, I think because of vagrant's insecure key and the updated crypto policies.)

But I'm still not seeing any TypeErrors when I try to use md5:

 [vagrant@centos8 ~]$ python3 -c 'import hashlib; print(hashlib.md5().hexdigest())'
 d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e

Not even if I add the env var:

 [vagrant@centos8 ~]$ OPENSSL_FIPS=1 python3 -c 'import hashlib; print(hashlib.md5().hexdigest())'
 d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e

I think it maybe comes down to hashlib.md5 not coming from openssl?

 [vagrant@centos8 ~]$ python3
 Python 3.6.8 (default, Oct  7 2019, 17:58:22) 
 [GCC 8.2.1 20180905 (Red Hat 8.2.1-3)] on linux
 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
 >>> import hashlib
 >>> hashlib.sha256
 <built-in function openssl_sha256>
 >>> hashlib.md5
 <built-in function md5>

Which might be why there's no usedforsecurity param available:

 >>> import inspect
 >>> inspect.signature(hashlib.md5)
 <Signature (string=b'')>


Maybe I need to install some *other `python3`? But even `md5sum` works:

 [vagrant@centos8 ~]$ md5sum /dev/null
 d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e  /dev/null

Any ideas on what I'm doing wrong?

Sean, I don't think this will require any releases or requirements changes; the shim was copied verbatim to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/751966/11/swift/common/utils.py@4853 -- so I suppose the Depends-On isn't really necessary, though it's nice to have the reference.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-07 19:39:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: -Code-Review

> Sean, I don't think this will require any releases or requirements
 > changes; the shim was copied verbatim to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/751966/11/swift/common/utils.py@4853
 > -- so I suppose the Depends-On isn't really necessary, though it's
 > nice to have the reference.

Oops, quite right."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-07 21:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Tim,

I think you're on the right track in that the md5 is not provided by openssl.

I have: 

[stack@undercloud nova]$ python3
Python 3.6.8 (default, Apr 16 2020, 01:36:27) 
[GCC 8.3.1 20191121 (Red Hat 8.3.1-5)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import hashlib
>>> hashlib.md5
<built-in function openssl_md5>
>>> hashlib.md5()

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-15 04:31:45.000000000', 'message': 'replace md5 with oslo_utils version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See <link> for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() his being added to
oslo.utils (secretutils.md5)

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

While this patch seems large, it is really just the same change over and
again.  Reviewers need to pay particular attention as to whether the
keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) is set correctly.   The vast majority
of md5 uses are not in a security context.

In fact, in this initial patch, I believe all the uses I have flagged are
non-security related.  The only ones I had concerns about -- and which
are not in this patch are in swift/common/middleware/crypto/decrypter.py

Change-Id: Ibb4917da4c083e1e094156d748708b87387f2d87

'}, {'created': '2020-09-18 21:56:15.000000000', 'message': 'replace md5 with oslo_utils version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() is added to
swift/common/utils.py.  This encapsulation is identical to the one being
added to oslo.utils, but is recreated here to avoid adding a dependency.

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

While this patch seems large, it is really just the same change over and
again.  Reviewers need to pay particular attention as to whether the
keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) is set correctly.   Right now, all
of them appear to be not used in a security context.

Now that all the instances have been converted, we can update the bandit
run to look for these instances and ensure that new invocations do not
creep in.

Change-Id: Ibb4917da4c083e1e094156d748708b87387f2d87
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

'}, {'created': '2020-09-29 18:19:01.000000000', 'message': 'replace md5 with swift utils version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() is added to
swift/common/utils.py.  This encapsulation is identical to the one being
added to oslo.utils, but is recreated here to avoid adding a dependency.

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

While this patch seems large, it is really just the same change over and
again.  Reviewers need to pay particular attention as to whether the
keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) is set correctly.   Right now, all
of them appear to be not used in a security context.

Now that all the instances have been converted, we can update the bandit
run to look for these instances and ensure that new invocations do not
creep in.

With this latest patch, the functional and unit tests almost all pass
on a FIPS enabled system.  The only failures are in the
test_log_msg_template and test_str_anonymizer tests.  These involve
using a hash to encrypt a string swift/common/utils.py (line 677).
This seems to me to be an impermissible use of md5, but it looks like
we can configure the use of a different hash algorithm.  So what should
we do here?

Change-Id: Ibb4917da4c083e1e094156d748708b87387f2d87
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/
'}, {'created': '2020-11-06 07:54:39.000000000', 'message': 'replace md5 with swift utils version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() is added to
swift/common/utils.py.  This encapsulation is identical to the one being
added to oslo.utils, but is recreated here to avoid adding a dependency.

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

While this patch seems large, it is really just the same change over and
again.  Reviewers need to pay particular attention as to whether the
keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) is set correctly.   Right now, all
of them appear to be not used in a security context.

Now that all the instances have been converted, we can update the bandit
run to look for these instances and ensure that new invocations do not
creep in.

With this latest patch, the functional and unit tests all pass
on a FIPS enabled system.

Change-Id: Ibb4917da4c083e1e094156d748708b87387f2d87

add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() is added to
swift/common/utils.py.  This encapsulation is identical to the one being
added to oslo.utils, but is recreated here to avoid adding a dependency.

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

While this patch seems large, it is really just the same change over and
again.  Reviewers need to pay particular attention as to whether the
keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) is set correctly.   Right now, all
of them appear to be not used in a security context.

Now that all the instances have been converted, we can update the bandit
run to look for these instances and ensure that new invocations do not
creep in.

With this latest patch, the functional and unit tests all pass
on a FIPS enabled system.

Co-Authored-By: Pete Zaitcev
Change-Id: Ibb4917da4c083e1e094156d748708b87387f2d87
'}]
commit_message:
replace md5 with swift utils version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() is added to
swift/common/utils.py.  This encapsulation is identical to the one being
added to oslo.utils, but is recreated here to avoid adding a dependency.

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

While this patch seems large, it is really just the same change over and
again.  Reviewers need to pay particular attention as to whether the
keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) is set correctly.   Right now, all
of them appear to be not used in a security context.

Now that all the instances have been converted, we can update the bandit
run to look for these instances and ensure that new invocations do not
creep in.

With this latest patch, the functional and unit tests all pass
on a FIPS enabled system.

Co-Authored-By: Pete Zaitcev
Change-Id: Ibb4917da4c083e1e094156d748708b87387f2d87

commit_message:
Move linters dependencies to tox.ini

Another item noted with the new pip resolver [1], linters dependencies
in test-requirements.txt may cause resolver issues (trying to pull in
enum34), conflicting requirements and cause them to be installed for all
test jobs. Move them to tox.ini as was done for some projects already
(this may be backported/squashed with pip resolver fix in stable
branches depending on how fixing these will go).

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019362.html

Change-Id: I0111c41bea6a6caf5ffba1f5c34489854d9c9747

commit_message:
s3-tests: Only try to copy outputs when there *are* outputs

That way we avoid POST_FAILUREs when the real problem was in run.

Change-Id: I9eb84d1c794d58f0af3b7d78d3bc4660c1823dc8

commit_message:
Sync release-tools

Sync release-tools boilerplate containing these changes
in order to pin pip < 20.3:
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/125
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/126
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/127
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/pull/129

Also removed non-existent zaza test class.
zaza-openstack-tests doesn't contain any cinder purestorage
tests, neither in `master` nor in any branch or PR. This
test class has been referenced here since the beginning of
this project and I wonder how this has ever worked.

Change-Id: Ic28a504639bf835ffcc50fa004c30c03542e1322

commit_message:
Fix wait condition for retry

Tenancity expects you use one it's waiting methods and not a fixed
number. This currently doesn't retry and stops all builds from
continuing to run.

# centos-7-container-updates -> nv
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/766857
Change-Id: Ia2b61cb698677968ef990d5577918be3aa4e2450
Closes-Bug: #1904025
(cherry picked from commit 52112d428defc2d2d03ba7a0b261cc4c51f50765)

commit_message:

Lower constraints should be fixed first'}, {'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2020-12-16 01:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-12-16 09:55:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hello,

You've few issues here:
- You've a merge conflict due to https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/automaton/+/766221 that removed hacking from test-requirements.txt
- Our lower-constraints job is broken due to pip's new resolver (c.f http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019149.html) and this should be addressed first.

I would really prefer to address the pip resolver issue through a separated patch to avoid to mix topics, however until this problem isn't solved we aren't able to merge your patches as our gate is broken.

Hopefully it will help you."}, {'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2020-12-18 09:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: Iaa239cde7d159f3098fdc22c826ee4dc4c52332a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 23:36:53.000000000', 'message': 'Update devDependencies in package.json

This patch updates outdated JavaScript dev dependencies.

The latest ESLint version adds rules changes. Some rules are disabled
to prevent checks failures, some minor issues are fixed.

The latest Jasmine version makes nested beforeEach fail, this was
fixed.

Also, the latest Jasmine version runs tests in random order by default,
random is set to false for now to prevent tests failures.

Finally, the latest Jasmine version supports a new configuration option
failSpecWithNoExpectations. By default, this option is set to false and
Jasmine reports specs that have no expectations as passed. Setting this
option to true tells Jasmine to report specs without as expectations as
failed. For now, it is set to false for openstack-dashboard tests, this
should be changed in future.

Change-Id: I04d5c3ce7f7e0a9a38251e975b68bfa1998e556f

commit_message:
Update devDependencies in package.json

This patch updates outdated JavaScript dev dependencies.

The latest Jasmine version makes nested beforeEach and unhandled
promise rejection fail, this was fixed.

Also, the latest Jasmine version runs tests in random order by default,
random is set to false for now to prevent tests failures.

Finally, the latest Jasmine version supports a new configuration option
failSpecWithNoExpectations. By default, this option is set to false and
Jasmine reports specs that have no expectations as passed. Setting this
option to true tells Jasmine to report specs without as expectations as
failed. For now, it is set to false for openstack-dashboard tests, this
should be changed in future.

Change-Id: I04d5c3ce7f7e0a9a38251e975b68bfa1998e556f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-10 10:56:52.000000000', 'message': 'Pause the ssh connection for 1 min to avoid getpwuid issue

Ansible under the hood uses python and python tries to find out
the group id for an user, but ansible tasks fails while trying
to find the gid of the user.

Adding pause might fix the issue.

Related-Bug: #1907651

Change-Id: I20e9f12a25661f83c5b977af86bc77828de3ae6d
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Pause the ssh connection for 1 min to avoid getpwuid issue

Ansible under the hood uses python and python tries to find out
the group id for an user, but ansible tasks fails while trying
to find the gid of the user.

Adding pause might fix the issue.

Related-Bug: #1907651

Change-Id: I20e9f12a25661f83c5b977af86bc77828de3ae6d
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

In order to attach a virtual function to an instance,
it is necessary to create a vnic_type = direct port
using neutron API in advance before creating an instance.

With this change, you can create a virtual function attached instance
with only one command by adding the vnic_type option to the nova API
for instance creation. Due to this change, the nova API microversions

commit_message:
Enable instance to be booted with neutron SR-IOV ports

In order to attach a virtual function to an instance,
it is necessary to create a vnic_type = direct port
using neutron API in advance before creating an instance.

With this change, you can create a virtual function attached instance
with only one command by adding the vnic_type option to the nova API
for instance creation. Due to this change, the nova API microversions
has been raised to 2.82.

Change-Id: Ib6fc207c124022e68422ef54525ab11848c4227a
blueprint: pci-passthrough-sriov

commit_message:
Allow setting VHD GUIDs

Hyper-V exposes the VHD GUIDs to guests, which can be used to
easily identify attached disks.

This change will allow setting the VHD GUID for new as well as
existing images.

Worth mentioning that the Kubernetes Openstack provider will
benefit from this. Without it, k8s Persistent Volumes can't be
identified by some guests.

http://paste.openstack.org/raw/801011/

Change-Id: Ied73997e6f5f3ded9827703867f059ef3dfca159

subject: Avoid caching images when unshelving
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-12-14 12:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2020-12-17 17:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2020-12-18 07:30:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-14 12:37:56.000000000', 'message': "Avoid caching images when unshelving

Shelved instances are snapshotted and then uploaded to Glance.
Once unshelved, the Glance snapshot is removed, so there's no
reason why we should cache it. Furthermore, at the moment
unshelved instances can end up using the wrong image reference,
for example when being migrated.

This change will avoid caching the base image when the instance
is being unshelved.

Closes-Bug: #1907216

Change-Id: I09a0fccdabdc7a41211e364258ca243128784b55
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid caching images when unshelving

Shelved instances are snapshotted and then uploaded to Glance.
Once unshelved, the Glance snapshot is removed, so there's no
reason why we should cache it. Furthermore, at the moment
unshelved instances can end up using the wrong image reference,
for example when being migrated.

This change will avoid caching the base image when the instance
is being unshelved.

Closes-Bug: #1907216

Change-Id: I09a0fccdabdc7a41211e364258ca243128784b55

commit_message:
DNM: skip stackviz in horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin

stackviz in rocky tempest does not work as the latest stackviz and
its dependencies are not compatible with python 3.5.
While other workarounds are being explored, skipping stackviz in
rocky tempest is one option. tempest 23.0.0 is used in rocky,
so we cannot change it in tempest, so this tries to delete
stackviz-latest.tar.gz cache file in advance (in "pre" playbook).

Change-Id: I677ccf18df8a2974f9c203c223bf035429289466

commit_message:
Remove retired Searchlight support

Searchlight project is retiring in Wallaby cycle[1].
This commit removes the usage of Searchlight project
before its code is removed.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/searchlight/+/764526

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018637.html

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Also fix sphinx doc requirements to make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615

Closes-Bug: #1907438
Change-Id: I294d5350e2f418614e54ff7bdd47dff16bfdcdbc
(cherry picked from commit 1f2326cd7cf5f8e32a55091f976f917093a0bede)
(cherry picked from commit cac096fcd64213f1e2cfa0848ca9af40a89fc952)

commit_message:
CI: Use only py3, remove lower-constraints check, cap ipa-b version

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Along with this, in order to unblock CI, we need to also cap the
version of ipa-b because the tinycore 11 image does not build on
older versions of linux, and along with this the testing
library constraints that are resolved now now error on python2 being
used, so changing jobs to use only python3.

Change-Id: Iab279c57676dba8faa87ab7523e577d3b65eb428

commit_message:
Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Also disabling dstat in all focal based jobs because of
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/dstat/+bug/1866619

Change-Id: Iab279c57676dba8faa87ab7523e577d3b65eb428
(cherry picked from commit 0bbba8e62f0b9f68df5098c31a0eec6b428c2797)

commit_message:
CI: switch the multinode job to tempest-multinode-full-base

The non-base job is designed for the integrated gate and may have
unnecessary side effects. It has recently overriding the OVS agent
bridge settings, breaking our job.

Make the job voting again.

Also Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Maybe stream turns out to be too unstable for us to support? Much like we don't support non-LTS ubuntu?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-12-10 08:37:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > wow, I wonder how it ended up succeeding in the gate just a few days ago
> 
> Maybe stream turns out to be too unstable for us to support? Much like we don't support non-LTS ubuntu?

Yeah, it starts to worry me as well."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-12-10 12:51:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > wow, I wonder how it ended up succeeding in the gate just a few days ago
> 
> Maybe stream turns out to be too unstable for us to support? Much like we don't support non-LTS ubuntu?

well by that metric fedora is unsupportable given its much more unstable.

and honestly no centos stream is a mid point between fedora and rhel
everything that is ends up in centos 8.X or rhel 8.X happens in centos stream first.
so we would just hit the change at the next minor point release.

if we were to only support LTS release we would basically have to drop everything but ubuntu/debian
and maybe suse. we cant actully use RHEL in the gate so that s only supported because of CENTOS
with the fact there is no centos9 coming just a centos9-stream if we want to keep any rhel proxy
after rhel 9 comes out the stream release will be our only choice."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-12-10 12:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

oh by the way we do support the latest ubuntu release in addtion to the latest lts

https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/master/doc/source/overview.rst#base-os'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-12-14 14:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-12-15 13:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-12-15 19:58:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-12-15 19:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-12-15 19:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-09 23:57:10.000000000', 'message': 'fix is_fedora for centos 8 stream

When deploying on the centos 8 stream variant
the output of "lsb_release -i -s" is
CentOSStream instead of CentOS

This breaks the is_fedora function in devstack
preventing package installation and removeal.

This change make the comparison a substring
check instead of equality to suppot both
CentOS and CentOSStream.

Change-Id: I39ccefbd06f46adf5077f8d8001f37d3b190f040
'}, {'created': '2020-12-15 13:17:39.000000000', 'message': 'fix is_fedora for centos 8 stream

This change make the comparison a substring

'}, {'created': '2020-12-15 19:58:41.000000000', 'message': 'fix is_fedora for centos 8 stream

commit_message:
fix is_fedora for centos 8 stream

When deploying on the centos 8 stream variant
the output of "lsb_release -i -s" is
CentOSStream instead of CentOS

This breaks the is_fedora function in devstack
preventing package installation and removal.

Change-Id: I39ccefbd06f46adf5077f8d8001f37d3b190f040

commit_message:
Move ansible-runner version to 1.4.0

Upstream requirements in stable/train is under ansible-runner 1.4.0.
This patch move the version to 1.4.0 according to openstack/requirements.
It changes the backward compat version according to this version in
validations_libs/ansible.py

Change-Id: I311d077c13a7d95314eb83072f5652646fef1bf8

subject: Cap oslo.db==6.0.0 for python <='3.5'
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-15 01:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-12-15 08:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

nova rocky gate test https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/67edcd21a0144bd7a3e0a28294bd5874
horizon rocky gate https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/acf6ccdf1b304cb29ab41baa0d80ec55
Both hit POST_FAILURE: oslo.db requires Python '>=3.6' but the running Python is 3.5.2

On the other hand, stackviz tempest-full-rocky succeeds with a gate testing patch.
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/stackviz/+/767065
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/df32b8cd11734651983e27a504483cbe

Thus, even though tempest-full-rocky in "Try stable/rocky gate fix" https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/stackviz/+/767063 succeeds, it does not mean it fixes the rocky gate.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-12-15 08:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I tried another option to skip vizstack. My test patch in horizon is https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/767066 and horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin job succeeded (https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/08f9404d28ac4080abfe9b4be1a6a20e).
If we go to this route, we can move this patch to devstack/playbooks/pre.yaml as a workaround.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-12-15 08:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is what I am not sure.
When I created a virtualenv using python 3.5 and run "pip install -U ..../stackviz-latest.tar.gz", oslo.db 6.0.0 which is compatible with python 3.5 was picked up.
In the failing tempest jobs, oslo.db 8.5.0 was picked up. subunit2sql 1.1.0 was used in both my venv test with python 3.5 and the failing tempest jobs.
I don't know where this difference comes from so far.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-12-15 08:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

-1 temporarily based on my above three comments'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-15 17:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> nova rocky gate test https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/67edcd21a0144bd7a3e0a28294bd5874
> horizon rocky gate https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/acf6ccdf1b304cb29ab41baa0d80ec55
> Both hit POST_FAILURE: oslo.db requires Python '>=3.6' but the running Python is 3.5.2
> 
> On the other hand, stackviz tempest-full-rocky succeeds with a gate testing patch.
> https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/stackviz/+/767065
> https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/df32b8cd11734651983e27a504483cbe
> 
> Thus, even though tempest-full-rocky in "Try stable/rocky gate fix" https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/stackviz/+/767063 succeeds, it does not mean it fixes the rocky gate.

yeah, stackviz stable/rocky is base don tempest-full-py3 which is py3 job not based on tempest-full which is py2 version -https://github.com/openstack/stackviz/blob/89f78ae1477bd75df9124eeb5636caee5897c208/.zuul.yaml#L25

We do not cover the py2 version of rocky in stackviz so that is why we could not see this failure here.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-15 18:05:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am adding py2 tempest-full version for rocky in which should fail - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/stackviz/+/767193'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-15 18:08:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I tried another option to skip vizstack. My test patch in horizon is https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/767066 and horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin job succeeded (https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/08f9404d28ac4080abfe9b4be1a6a20e).
> If we go to this route, we can move this patch to devstack/playbooks/pre.yaml as a workaround.

Let's try this fix, if it does not work then I agree to move your workaround on devstack side. Let's see if we can avoid devstack change."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-15 23:49:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I am adding py2 tempest-full version for rocky in which should fail - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/stackviz/+/767193

seems like tempest-full rocky on master gate is passing  - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/stackviz/+/767193'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-16 19:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this is working , tested in nova gate where tempest-full is green now - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/767027/'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-16 19:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> this is working , tested in nova gate where tempest-full is green now - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/767027/

That passed as it picked old oslo.db not sure why.

But any fix in stackviz would not be picked up until that is merged and published as stackviz-latest.tar.gz'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-12-17 09:39:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

As discussed with gmann in IRC we agreed that we will try this patch as the first option.
If it does not work, we will switch to the next option which skips stackviz to avoid longer breakage in stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-17 15:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-17 22:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-17 22:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-17 23:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-12-17 23:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

i'm ok with capping the version .. +2"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-18 00:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Cap oslo.db==6.0.0 for python <='3.5'

stackviz on stable/rocky is failing as it try to install the
latest requirements like oslo.db>=4.24.0

:stderr: oslo.db requires Python '>=3.6' but the running Python is 3.5.2

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/67edcd21a0144bd7a3e0a28294bd5874

Change-Id: I1c65b90ee4579c0e58d9c01a1244760dc74b82b3

commit_message:
Drop VCPU -> PCPU reshape

Now that we've removed support for 'vcpu_pin_set', we should no longer
have anyone that hasn't already updated their configuration and
triggered the reshape. As such, we can now delete this.

messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-12-17 15:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-12-17 18:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/767577/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 40m 06s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 15:54:31.000000000', 'message': 'Drop support for pinning of host siblings

Prior to Train, the 'isolate' CPU thread policy meant "give me a host
without thread siblings (i.e. no HyperThreading or other SMT
implementation) or emulate this on a host with thread siblings by
marking the thread siblings as unusable". When using Train or later with
the new style CPU configuration - namely '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set'
and '[compute] cpu_shared_set' - this changes to simply "give me a host
without thread siblings", which is enforced by requesting hosts
*without* the 'HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING' trait. Since we no longer support
the legacy code path, we will no longer expect to receive instances that
request the 'isolate' policy on hosts with thread siblings. This means
there is no need to keep support for the pinning and unpinning of cores
and their thread siblings around, so remove them.

Change-Id: I2dcac5f331df0f23592a1516e6a12fc899e8dc21
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Drop support for pinning of host siblings

Prior to Train, the 'isolate' CPU thread policy meant "give me a host
without thread siblings (i.e. no HyperThreading or other SMT
implementation) or emulate this on a host with thread siblings by
marking the thread siblings as unusable". When using Train or later with
the new style CPU configuration - namely '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set'
and '[compute] cpu_shared_set' - this changes to simply "give me a host
without thread siblings", which is enforced by requesting hosts
*without* the 'HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING' trait. Since we no longer support
the legacy code path, we will no longer expect to receive instances that
request the 'isolate' policy on hosts with thread siblings. This means
there is no need to keep support for the pinning and unpinning of cores
and their thread siblings around, so remove them.

Change-Id: I2dcac5f331df0f23592a1516e6a12fc899e8dc21
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Remove support for '[DEFAULT] vcpu_pin_set'
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-12-17 15:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-12-17 18:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/767576/1 : FAILURE in 2h 38m 34s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 15:54:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove support for '[DEFAULT] vcpu_pin_set'

This has been deprecated since Train. It's now time to remove it. This
is quite large, given the large number of compatibility shims in place
to handle the switch from this option to the '[compute] cpu_shared_set'
and '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set' options, however, it's removal will
allows us to also remove '[workarounds] disable_fallback_pcpu_query' as
well as the reshape code for PCPU -> VCPU and support for pinning of
thread siblings. We tackle these items separately in follow-ups to keep
this as small as possible, though we do have to remove the reshape
functional test since there's no longer an easy way to create an
instance using pinned CPUs on a host without PCPU inventory.

Change-Id: I6c00c12a4a663b0c91f051121231729d23a8b934
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove support for '[DEFAULT] vcpu_pin_set'

This has been deprecated since Train. It's now time to remove it. This
is quite large, given the large number of compatibility shims in place
to handle the switch from this option to the '[compute] cpu_shared_set'
and '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set' options, however, it's removal will
allows us to also remove '[workarounds] disable_fallback_pcpu_query' as
well as the reshape code for PCPU -> VCPU and support for pinning of
thread siblings. We tackle these items separately in follow-ups to keep
this as small as possible, though we do have to remove the reshape
functional test since there's no longer an easy way to create an
instance using pinned CPUs on a host without PCPU inventory.

Change-Id: I6c00c12a4a663b0c91f051121231729d23a8b934
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

The ansible network configs does a check if network
is in networks_skip_config. When networks_skip_config is
not defined in the role data it get's defined as 'null'
in the Ansible inventory.

Default it to an empty list when creating the GroupVars

(cherry picked from commit c8c9855678540ffb77734d46d7dd76f2b58ebf94)

commit_message:
Make sure networks_skip_config defaults to []

The ansible network configs does a check if network
is in networks_skip_config. When networks_skip_config is
not defined in the role data it get's defined as 'null'
in the Ansible inventory.

Default it to an empty list when creating the GroupVars
so that it's always of type: List in the inventory.

Change-Id: I0c09118b947aeee9b011e7d0ec23ab99af3680af
Closes-Bug: #1904808
(cherry picked from commit c8c9855678540ffb77734d46d7dd76f2b58ebf94)

commit_message:
Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Also Cap version of ipa-builder to 2.2.0

Versions higher than 2.2.0 of ironic-python-agent-builder use
tinycore 11.x to build tinyipa, and that uses a kernel too recent
to be built on bionic.

Change-Id: Iab279c57676dba8faa87ab7523e577d3b65eb428
(cherry picked from commit 0bbba8e62f0b9f68df5098c31a0eec6b428c2797)
(cherry picked from commit d5ae74e9b8a6b2aa602095b60286d5ab2f1da63a)

commit_message:
Fix default disk label with partition images

Partition images through the agent have the unfortunate
side effect of being executed without full node context
by default. Luckilly we've had a similar problem and
cache the node.

This patch changes the lookup from a default of msdos
partitions to use the cached node object.

Change-Id: I002816c9372fdf1cc32f3c67f420073551479fd9

Story: 2008070
Task: 40753
Change-Id: If17d4b4c06df5504987e61a1fde6662e9acd6989
'}, {'created': '2020-09-08 20:22:17.000000000', 'message': 'Support partition image efi contents

Partition images can sometimes contain a /boot folder structure
event he assets for EFI booting on that filesystem. Which is a
good thing. The conundrum is that Ironic does not handle this
properly and potentially replaces the bootloader in this sequence
such that grub2-install is used instead of signed bootloader assets.

As such, we should be preserving the assets and using them from
a partition image much like we do when we have a wholedisk
image and can identify the assets.

Now we will preserve the EFI boot assets, copy them to the new EFI
boot partition, and call the EFI setup methods to manage the EFI
nvram.

Note, this change also splits the logic path out that performs the
end call of the EFI boot manager into a reusable method but does
not retool all of the testing as it is intertwined in the
install_grub2 testing.

event he assets for EFI booting on that filesystem. Which is a
good thing. The conundrum is that Ironic does not handle this

not retool all of the testing as it is intertwined in the

installation code has multiple fallback/cleanup points which makes
it difficult to debug from logs.

commit_message:
Prevent broken partition image UEFI deploys

Partition images can sometimes contain a /boot folder structure
event he assets for EFI booting on that filesystem. Which is a
good thing. The conundrum is that Ironic does not handle this
properly and potentially replaces the bootloader in this sequence
such that grub2-install is used instead of signed bootloader assets.

As such, we should be preserving the assets and using them from
a partition image much like we do when we have a wholedisk
image and can identify the assets.

Now we will preserve the EFI boot assets, copy them to the new EFI
boot partition, and call the EFI setup methods to manage the EFI
nvram.

Note, this change also splits the logic path out that performs the
end call of the EFI boot manager into a reusable method but does
not retool all of the testing as it is intertwined in the
install_grub2 testing.

Also adds some additional debug logging, as much of the bootloader
installation code has multiple fallback/cleanup points which makes
it difficult to debug from logs.

Story: 2008070
Task: 40753
Change-Id: If17d4b4c06df5504987e61a1fde6662e9acd6989

commit_message:
Disable Apache 'status' module by default

'status' module exposed some security
risks as described in bug 1836513.

This change added apache 'status' module
to modules_to_disable so that /server-status
endpoint would not expose.

The change lands in charm-helpers lib by below PR:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/548

Closes-Bug: #1836513
Change-Id: Id2e58bbe11519befc90077050671b613da2a088d

commit_message:
Use python3 for stable/train testing

We have a dependency issue:

bandit requires Python '>=3.5' but the running Python is 2.7.17

However, python2.7 support is no longer required and we need
testing generally working to validate fixes are in a decent state.

Change-Id: I58fcaf690d62f5c00a7f294c26a0612633ccc2ce

commit_message:
tests: Rework some CPU pinning tests to use new config

We're going to drop support for the '[DEFAULT] vcpu_pin_set' config
option. Before we do that, rework some functional tests that are relying
on the legacy behavior.

Change-Id: Idf41d6188652d3dd473fe453d80725c67d545108
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix heat-dashboard installation for loci

Separate heat-dashboard was introduced since Queens.
Removing installation of heat-dashboard from Ocata and Pike, while
installing it from corresponding source for other releases.

Also adds PIP_PACKAGES to requirements image build.

Change-Id: I39f457f55d77200c9152d8c5a203ac8b3f9aa28c
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

[{'created': '2020-11-17 19:31:03.000000000', 'message': 'Increase default TimeoutStopSec value

The charm installs systemd overrides of the TimeoutStopSec and
TimeoutStartSec parameters for the corosync and pacemaker services.
The default timeout stop parameter is changed to 60s, which is a
significant change from the package level default of 30 minutes. The
pacemaker systemd default is 30 minutes to allow time for resources
to safely move off the node before shutting down. It can take some
time for services to migrate away under a variety of circumstances (node
usage, the resource, etc).

This change increases the timeout to 10 minutes by default, which should
prevent things like unattended-upgrades from causing outages due
services not starting because systemd timed out (and an instance was
already running).

Change-Id: Ie88982fe987b742082a978ff2488693d0154123b
Closes-Bug: #1903745

commit_message:
Increase default TimeoutStopSec value

The charm installs systemd overrides of the TimeoutStopSec and
TimeoutStartSec parameters for the corosync and pacemaker services.
The default timeout stop parameter is changed to 60s, which is a
significant change from the package level default of 30 minutes. The
pacemaker systemd default is 30 minutes to allow time for resources
to safely move off the node before shutting down. It can take some
time for services to migrate away under a variety of circumstances (node
usage, the resource, etc).

This change increases the timeout to 10 minutes by default, which should
prevent things like unattended-upgrades from causing outages due
services not starting because systemd timed out (and an instance was
already running).

Change-Id: Ie88982fe987b742082a978ff2488693d0154123b
Closes-Bug: #1903745

commit_message:
ScaleIO: Connection info backward compatibility

When we fixed bug 1823200 in Change-ID
Iab54c515fe7be252df52b1a0503a251779805759 we made the ScaleIO connector
incompatible with the old connection properties dictionary as it only
supported the new 'config_group' and 'failed_over' parameters to get the
password.

This is a problem in any system that is upgraded and has attachments to
the array, because the connection properties of those volumes will not
contain the new fields and detaching them will result in error
"KeyError: 'config_group'".

This patch adds compatibility code to support the old connection
properties format so we can detach those volumes.

This patch includes the release note from Change
Ib98043358d51426ca650104ad59a7e09911ee8e9

Related-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: I6f01a178616b74ed9a86876ca46e7e46eb360518
(cherry picked from commit 54504830828757e9d72e9440dde9cff33684a74d)
(cherry picked from commit 31589a624fe8d2ebb56ccbd9c94a8dd559a7da89)
Conflicts:
	os_brick/initiator/connectors/scaleio.py
(cherry picked from commit db95b001e2fe53a71ec0b881407ecdf7c3db32fc)
(cherry picked from commit 173601116eb5e00274b10898b56b37dc42d685ac)
Conflicts:
	os_brick/initiator/connectors/scaleio.py
	os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_scaleio.py
(cherry picked from commit 43da3cd47b3cc23d4f0f046bc16e34d5267a5b38)

[{'created': '2020-11-30 11:50:03.000000000', 'message': 'Raise file limits to allow max-connections >4190

Install a systemd unit override with LimitNOFILE raised to the required number
based on the same calculation the server performs to ensure both the requested
max_connections and table_open_cache values can be met.

The MySQL server does make some attempt to do this itself when started as root
which worked under Xenial, however in Bionic the systemd service is started as
the mysql user with LimitNOFILE=5000. As a result, the server cannot raise the
limit itself and caps max-connections to 4190 and table-open-cache to 200
and logging a warning to that effect:
[Warning] Changed limits: max_connections: 4190 (requested 12000)

More background:
https://www.percona.com/blog/2017/10/12/open_files_limit-mystery/

Change-Id: I25b429cc9b4970e3d7ef39bb9e6d738fe943686f
Closes-Bug: #1905366

The MySQL server does make some attempt to do this itself when started
as root which worked under Xenial, however in Bionic the systemd service
is started as the mysql user with LimitNOFILE=5000. As a result, the
server cannot raise the limit itself and caps max-connections to 4190,
table-open-cache to 200 and logs a warning to that effect:
[Warning] Changed limits: max_connections: 4190 (requested 12000)

commit_message:
Raise file limits to allow max-connections >4190

Install a systemd unit override with LimitNOFILE raised to the required
number based on the same calculation the server performs to ensure both
the requested max_connections and table_open_cache values can be met.

The MySQL server does make some attempt to do this itself when started
as root which worked under Xenial, however in Bionic the systemd service
is started as the mysql user with LimitNOFILE=5000. As a result, the
server cannot raise the limit itself and caps max-connections to 4190,
table-open-cache to 200 and logs a warning to that effect:
[Warning] Changed limits: max_connections: 4190 (requested 12000)

More background:
https://www.percona.com/blog/2017/10/12/open_files_limit-mystery/

Change-Id: I25b429cc9b4970e3d7ef39bb9e6d738fe943686f
Closes-Bug: #1905366

commit_message:
Fix change default cidr to IPv6 one

It became not possible to use IPv4 cidr to create rules.
The following tests were failed:

SecGroupIPv6Test.
test_create_show_delete_security_group_rule

NegativeSecGroupIPv6Test.
test_create_duplicate_security_group_rule_fails

NegativeSecGroupIPv6Test.
test_create_security_group_rule_with_non_existent_security_group

Error description is:
Conflicting value ethertype IPv6 for CIDR 0.0.0.0/0'

Fix adds IPv6 cidr usage for described 3 tests

Closes-Bug: #1908426
Change-Id: Ic2bba932d41408530fa1a7bb0cdb36f34f4aa4a6

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Correct naming convention for logical volumes in disk_zap()

OSD logical volume names used to be based on the logical disk path,
i.e. /dev/sdb, but that has changed. The lvremove logic in disk_zap()
is still using the old naming convention. This change fixes that.

Change-Id: If32ab354670166a3c844991de1744de63a508303

commit_message:
[stable-only] zuul: Remove Fedora jobs prior to Victoria

fedora-latest now points at Fedora 32 which is not supported prior to
Victoria. As we don't support earlier releases of Fedora outside their
own life cycles we should just remove Fedora jobs from these older
branches.

Change-Id: I9b1e674f50f2966d46bced6663f4a2735be0685d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-17 15:18:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inspect images calls to not use the index format keyword

Via https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752937/ we added the following code:
       if container_image:
            image_id_str = self.runner.inspect(
                container_image, "{{index .Id}}", o_type='image')
            if str(image_id_str).strip() != inspect_info.get('Image'):
                self.log.debug("Deleting container (image updated): "
                               "%s" % container)
                self.runner.remove_container(container)
                return True

This code works fine in docker:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}' f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

But is problematic in podman (both on 1.6.4 and 2.1.1 versions):
[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}'
undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/rh-osbs/rhosp16-openstack-cinder-volume:16.2_20201110.2-hotfixupdate2
ERRO[0000] Error printing inspect output: Template parsing error:
template: image:1:8: executing "image" at <.Id>: can't evaluate field Id
in type *entities.ImageInspectReport

This has the side-effect of restarting all containers at each identical
redeploy.

We can just drop the 'index' in the query since it works in both docker
and podman:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
5093412f3a08

Change-Id: I8b1fbbb7499a69e7a131fd8650c6f50fb4ab978e
Closes-Bug: #1904043
(cherry picked from commit 7e496911451b5d6fca9766fe1e294c7e5e5523ff)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inspect images calls to not use the index format keyword

Via https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752937/ we added the following code:
       if container_image:
            image_id_str = self.runner.inspect(
                container_image, "{{index .Id}}", o_type='image')
            if str(image_id_str).strip() != inspect_info.get('Image'):
                self.log.debug("Deleting container (image updated): "
                               "%s" % container)
                self.runner.remove_container(container)
                return True

This code works fine in docker:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}' f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

But is problematic in podman (both on 1.6.4 and 2.1.1 versions):
[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}'
undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/rh-osbs/rhosp16-openstack-cinder-volume:16.2_20201110.2-hotfixupdate2
ERRO[0000] Error printing inspect output: Template parsing error:
template: image:1:8: executing "image" at <.Id>: can't evaluate field Id
in type *entities.ImageInspectReport

This has the side-effect of restarting all containers at each identical
redeploy.

We can just drop the 'index' in the query since it works in both docker
and podman:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
5093412f3a08

Change-Id: I8b1fbbb7499a69e7a131fd8650c6f50fb4ab978e
Closes-Bug: #1904043
(cherry picked from commit 7e496911451b5d6fca9766fe1e294c7e5e5523ff)

commit_message:
Update ESLint devDependencies in package.json

This patch updates outdated JavaScript dev dependencies.

The latest ESLint version adds rules changes. Some rules are disabled
to prevent checks failures, some minor issues are fixed.

Change-Id: I01c5ccb5c8f7ceb827a3978157b4d76805d259c1

commit_message:
[Doc] Remove description about v1 api and glance-registry

Image v1 API and glance-registry has been removed from Glance.
This patch removes all descriptions about these 2 items, since they
are no longer available.

Change-Id: Ic72921523f73dcae5e9c443a55edecb710b2d251

Use 'bash' in the keepalived check script

Use bash instead of sh to avoid the error "shopt: not found"

Change-Id: Ib089affa229531cd72f6853105d74b446687ae86

* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to v1.7.1. On seed-hypervisors installed
  using CentOS 8.2 or earlier, interaction with libvirt may fail due to
  libgcrypt being incompatible. See
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/issues/42

* Bump MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.9.2. The CentOS 8.3 cloud image
  includes an ifcfg-ens3-1 file. See
  https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/93

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,
  however changes in libvirt 6.0.0 to separate libvirtd into multiple
  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host
  daemons. Update the Tenks config to use the containerised Nova libvirt
  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/pull/44

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python
  dependencies. Remove upper limits from docker and paramiko.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/766211
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/766279

commit_message:
Fixes for CentOS 8.3

* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to v1.7.1. On seed-hypervisors installed
  using CentOS 8.2 or earlier, interaction with libvirt may fail due to
  libgcrypt being incompatible. See
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/issues/42

* Bump MichaelRigart.interfaces to v1.9.2. The CentOS 8.3 cloud image
  includes an ifcfg-ens3-1 file. See
  https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/93

* Previously a second libvirt daemon was installed by Tenks on the host,
  however changes in libvirt 6.0.0 to separate libvirtd into multiple
  daemons do not allow for customisation of the PID files used by the
  new daemons. This leads to a conflict between the container and host
  daemons. Update the Tenks config to use the containerised Nova libvirt
  daemon. This depends on a change to the stackhpc.libvirt-host role:
  https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-host/pull/44

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but tox jobs are now failing on python
  dependencies. Remove upper limits from docker and paramiko.

* Not CentOS 8.3 related, but Bifrost has enabled authentication by
  default. We are not ready to support this, so override it.

Story: 2008429
Task: 41378

Change-Id: Ie8fd965165e8d347d27528a2c16d0647e412ccdc

commit_message:
functional: Add live migration tests for PCI, SR-IOV servers

There are a few holes here, mostly to do with dodgy mocking from
fakelibvirt, but it's a start that we can build upon in future changes.

Change-Id: Ic641d9b975710538beb6dd9af55cc940501623da
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update outdated descripton for `default_boot_option`

The default value of `default_boot_option` has already been
'local', so update the note.

Change-Id: Ia846fa82121cda942697a240eec5bbd7bd93e68e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 12:57:59.000000000', 'message': "Bring up VLAN interfaces and include in introspection report

Add the ability to bring up VLAN interfaces and include them in the
introspection report.  A new configuration field is added -
``ipa-enable-vlan-interfaces``, which defines either the VLAN interface
to enable, the interface to use, or 'all' - which indicates all
interfaces.  If the particular VLAN is not provided, IPA will
use the lldp info for the interface to determine which VLANs should
be enabled.

Change-Id: Icb4f66a02b298b4d165ebb58134cd31029e535cc
Story: 2008298
Task: 41183
(cherry picked from commit 6e3f28d720c838b66a570babeb3f36f36c48bf1f)

commit_message:
Bring up VLAN interfaces and include in introspection report

Add the ability to bring up VLAN interfaces and include them in the
introspection report.  A new configuration field is added -
``ipa-enable-vlan-interfaces``, which defines either the VLAN interface
to enable, the interface to use, or 'all' - which indicates all
interfaces.  If the particular VLAN is not provided, IPA will
use the lldp info for the interface to determine which VLANs should
be enabled.

Change-Id: Icb4f66a02b298b4d165ebb58134cd31029e535cc
Story: 2008298
Task: 41183

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 12:33:01.000000000', 'message': "[Train Only] Use ID/VERSION_ID to detect distro

It was missed in original cherry-picks[1] as ussuri+
don't have that code. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If14f4edad391fd9ee61851859ecdd3a51b97a215

commit_message:
[Train Only] Use ID/VERSION_ID to detect distro

It was missed in original cherry-picks[1] as ussuri+
don't have that code. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/If14f4edad391fd9ee61851859ecdd3a51b97a215

Change-Id: I9a59f77e24e61e0088b05ffb580442a54b94746c

[{'created': '2020-12-17 14:34:11.000000000', 'message': 'Cap version of ipa-builder to 2.2.0

Versions higher than 2.2.0 of ironic-python-agent-builder use
tinycore 11.x to build tinyipa, and that uses a kernel too recent
to be built on bionic.

Change-Id: I1ba0794bbe3bf3584df8d6dc8d3763fd1476fb70
'}]
commit_message:
Cap version of ipa-builder to 2.2.0

Versions higher than 2.2.0 of ironic-python-agent-builder use
tinycore 11.x to build tinyipa, and that uses a kernel too recent
to be built on bionic.

Change-Id: I1ba0794bbe3bf3584df8d6dc8d3763fd1476fb70

commit_message:
Run LVM filter tasks when enabled, regardless of allow/deny list size

When the LVM filter is enabled, it should also run when the allow list
is empty.

Change-Id: I88ec250cb3e29c08ce7e7f5e02b5e7e48f997fea
Closes-Bug: #1907452
(cherry picked from commit 20f1e9766befc0d5c86e6deae45c5ca3de101b38)

commit_message:
[Ussuri/Train] Check mode doesn't work for async tasks

In order to get a successful "check" run of the ansible generated
content (via config-download), we have to ignore the async tasks.

Since the affected async tasks have been removed in V cycle, this patch
affects only U and T.

Change-Id: I0bc8c398650e5d3e3f5b244cc516fcefd0d3aa4a
Closes: rhbz#1823875
Related-Bug: #1874141

Separate volume tests from servers tests

Tag volume tests in servers as "object" so we can skip them when
volumes are not available.

[{'created': '2020-12-09 20:36:09.000000000', 'message': "Add validation around stream

We don't want to allow for stream repos when we don't have a stream
host. Additionally we don't want to disable stream repos when we have a
stream host. Both of these are incompatible so let's add better checking
when tripleo-repos are run.

Change-Id: I0740becea0ba60bfdd7b3256f99136d063f4b7bf
"}]
commit_message:
Add validation around stream

We don't want to allow for stream repos when we don't have a stream
host. Additionally we don't want to disable stream repos when we have a
stream host. Both of these are incompatible so let's add better checking
when tripleo-repos are run.

Change-Id: I0740becea0ba60bfdd7b3256f99136d063f4b7bf

commit_message:
Remove octavia_amp_image_id as it is deprecated.

The corresponding configuration option amp_image_id in Octavia is
deprected and image tags should be used instead.

Change-Id: I78c723197ee70b81831a441361d4b52dba2d4815

commit_message:
Update zuul layout with content provider jobs + improve coverage

This updates the zuul layout to include the undercloud & overcloud
upgrade/update jobs. The jobs are added as consumer jobs with the
required conten providers also appearing in the layout.

Change-Id: I5040180c73dea44e6cb477087946836a3b2017a8

commit_message:
Add config option for 'cluster-recheck-interval' property

This value is hard-coded to 60 seconds into the charm code.
This change adds a charm config option (with 60 secs as the
default value) in order to make the `cluster-recheck-interval`
property configurable.

Change-Id: I58f8d4831cf8de0b25d4d026f865e9b8075efe8b

[{'created': '2020-10-15 11:04:12.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Skip maintenance IGMP snoop check if not LS name

In case a logical switch has no name, skip the maintenance IGMP
snoop check.

NOTE: Neutron defines the logical switch name with the pattern
"neutron-<network_id>". This logical switch does not belong to
Neutron.

Change-Id: I1ccdadf8e90e0bbce13294cc329ed43e90fa0259
Closes-Bug: #1896205

commit_message:
[OVN] Skip maintenance IGMP snoop check if not LS name

In case a logical switch has no name, skip the maintenance IGMP
snoop check.

NOTE: Neutron defines the logical switch name with the pattern
"neutron-<network_id>". This logical switch does not belong to
Neutron.

Change-Id: I1ccdadf8e90e0bbce13294cc329ed43e90fa0259
Closes-Bug: #1896203

Code are basically same to the destroy_state_change_monitor which disable the neutron-state-change process. But for keepalived it has a process stucture like this:
PID         111     Keepalived  <-- Parent process monitoring children
            112     \_ Keepalived   <-- VRRP child
            113     \_ Keepalived   <-- Healthchecking child [neutron does not spawn this process]

So for the kill -9 action here, IIUC, it only kill the <pid_111>. The keepalived VRRP process <pid_112> will be killed as well? Or become zombie or left there forever if the singal does not pass from the parent to the child?

From my local test, it shows out that the keepalived VRRP can be killed as well. So I guess that keepalived Parent process passes the TERM signal to the child. But a very corner case, what if VRRP process is doing the failover work?

So, code looks good to me. We can go with this to see if something happens.

[1] https://keepalived.readthedocs.io/en/latest/software_design.html'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-12-17 07:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Ensure "keepalived" is correcly disabled

To stop a "keepalived" process, a SIGTERM signal is sent. This patch
checks if the process is not present in the system. If the instance
is still running after a short time, a SIGKILL signal is sent.

Change-Id: I2e784ea7e00c145135288bf309bb34ce311ac15c
Closes-Bug: #1908057
